timeline.bodyText: Is this necessary? AbtractMapIterable implements MapIterable
timeline.author: donraab

replies.bodyText: For transparency the default methods and implementations other than MapIterable are to fix compiler complaints, and I have put them at the highest place.
replies.author: nikhilnanivadekar

replies.bodyText: Not sure I understand. ImmutableMap extends ImmutableMapIterable which extends MapIterable so all ImmutableMap implementations should get the default implementation and the override in AbstractMapIterable should be unnecessary right?
replies.author: donraab

replies.bodyText: @donraab It is necessary because AbstractImmutableMap implements ImmutableMap, Map. So the immutable side gets the ambiguous method issue. Screenshot below:
replies.author: nikhilnanivadekar
